info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 17 at 3:01PM MDT until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Montana... Lodge Creek near International Border affecting Hill and Blaine Counties. .Warm temperatures melting snowpack have caused an increase in flooding category from Minor to Moderate, and will continue the cold, high, and fast creek flows. For the Lodge Creek...including International Border...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lodge Creek near International Border. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.3 feet, April 24 2018 - The Lodge Creek rose to near 10.3 feet this year. No impacts were reported, yet areal flooding did occur because of snowmelt in northern Hill and northern Blaine counties. The gauge is actually in southern Alberta. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:25 PM MDT Monday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:25 PM MDT Monday was 9.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is forecast to fall back down through Minor flood stage of 7.0 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.3 feet on 04/19/1955. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Lodge Creek International Borde 7.0 9.9 Mon 2 pm MDT 9.1 8.3 7.5 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1115 AM MDT.
